item.title: SMG | Tropical Cyclone may be tomorrow 800km from Macau
item.description:
The Tropical Cyclone Podul is intensifying east of Taiwan and will approach the southeast coast of China throughout the week. Meteorological and geophysical services estimate that they reach the degree of typhoon and is 800 kilometers from Macau on tomorrow afternoon and 400 kilometers on Thursday, when it will be tropical depression
After a few days of truce, the intense and thunderstorm rains will be able to hide Macao from mid -week as the impact of the Severo “Podul” tropical cyclone will intensify, which was yesterday located in the Northwest Pacific, east of Taiwan. Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) yesterday indicated that the storm is intensifying gradually and moving west at a speed of about 25 kilometers per hour. The latest forecast points to “Podul” intensify to the typhoon category when it is about 800 kilometers from Macau, tomorrow around 14h, when Taiwan will arrive. About 24 hours later, already on Thursday afternoon, predictions point to the reduction of the intensity of “Podul”, which will become a tropical depression, entering continental territory, about 400 kilometers northwest of Macao. Intensity questions Yesterday morning, the SMG still did not risk predicting a trajectory for the storm, pointing to two distinct predictions, before revealing the above estimate. "Different forecast models still have significant differences in their trajectories and subsequent development. Numerical models predict that the‘ Podul ’follow a more north trajectory towards the areas between Fujian and Zhejiang, but some numerical and artificial intelligence models predict a south more trajectory, approaching the east coast of Guangdong," said SMG. For now, the authorities report that the circulation of ‘podul’ is relatively small due to unfavorable development conditions, and it is expected to weaken after reaching Earth in Taiwan. The SMG warned yesterday to the continuation of “extremely hot in the coming days” due to the influence of “an anticyclone at high altitude”. However, with the approach of “Podul”, the weather on the coast of Guangdong will become unstable, with the likelihood of intense rain in the end of this week. If “Podul” follows a closer trajectory to the eastern coast of Guangdong, the wind and the rain in Macau will be more intense. The SMG appealed to the population to pay attention to the latest weather information, so that they can take contingency measures as soon as possible.

item.title: Food Waste | Pereira Coutinho suggests combat plan
item.description:
José Pereira Coutinho wants the government to combat food waste and the abundance culture of banquets and buffets to be coordinated with food banks and charities. The deputy asked if legislation is expected to encourage or oblige the separation of organic waste
Food waste in Macau is a problem for which Pereira Coutinho would like to see an integrated combat strategy. In a written interplies released yesterday, the deputy highlights the gap between the culture of abundance of social events and the operational difficulties in the collection of food surpluses for distribution to needy families and solidarity institutions. This culture, banquets, buffets and celebrations, “associated with commercial practices that oversee productions, generates critical volumes of surpluses, especially prepared breads, cakes and meals, aggravating the inefficiency of the food chain”, denounces the deputy. To solve food waste in the commercial sector, Pereira Coutinho asks the government if he intends to introduce “standards that encourage or oblige supermarkets, restaurants and other food companies to donate food surpluses still suitable for consumption to social solidarity institutions”. The deputy cites examples of laws in force in Portugal and France, which could be followed by the executive. In addition, it asks if it is possible to implement measures, such as tax incentives, logistical support, simplification of procedures or certification programs, to “facilitate the creation of systematic partnerships between commercial food establishments (supermarkets, restaurants, bakeries, hotels and others) and private entities such as food banks or charities”. So what about the environment? Putting the issue of food waste from the perspective of the popular concept of sustainability, Pereira Coutinho points out not only ethical challenges and their social and economic implications, but also environmental. Firstly, it is urgent to sensitize the population to the need to reduce food waste. The deputy then emphasizes the need to correct the “critical infrastructural disabilities in the management of organic waste, manifested in the absence of industrial composting centers and intelligent logistics networks to donate surpluses in time”. Also the ecological consequences, with greenhouse gas emissions, decomposition in landfills and incinerators, should be addressed. As such, Coutinho asks if the government considers it to create a legal framework that “encourages or obliges the separation of organic waste, namely eating waste, origin (domestic, commercial and institutional)”. The objective is to give proper treatment to waste, such as composting or anaerobic digestion, rather than the use of the landfill.

item.title: Administration | Ella Lei calls for more civil servants
item.description:
The maximum bargaining of civil servants is in 35,000, but Mrs Ella Lei wants to go beyond that. Speaking to the Citizen Journal, the deputy linked to the workers says it is necessary to respond to social development with more human resources
Ella Law, a deputy linked to the Macao Workers' Associations Federation (Faom), argues that more civil servants are needed in order to respond to the new developments of society. Speaking to Jornal do Citizen, the deputy points out that an digitization of services does not solve all problems in serving the population, and in her opinion, more human resources. The deputy recalled that the maximum number of civil servants defined by the executive in 2020 was 35,000 people, and remains in this bar. However, Ho Iat Seng is no longer chief executive, a position now held by Sam Ho Fai, and Ella Lei says there are areas of public administration that lack more paintings. He spoke, for example, of services related to the well-being of the population, especially in the area of health, where there is, according to the deputy, a great demand. Ella Lei also stated that there is a lack of paintings to move forward with prevention projects in this area. The official considers that public medical institutions are essential for health care, even if there is cooperation with private institutions. Thus, the deputy linked to the workers pointed out that it is necessary for the government to analyze if there is enough personnel in this area, otherwise there is great pressure at work. Border Ella Law also highlighted the case of security forces, arguing that a global analysis should be made to the number of agents, taking into account the growth in the number of border posts and the recovery of visitors to the pandemic years, which is already again in more than 30 million people per year. The legislator argued that they should be analyzed if police officers, firefighters and customs agents are sufficient to respond to the displacement of residents. For Ella Law, the lack of human resources in the area of security can affect the quality of services and the rest of workers. The deputy highlighted improvements, in the government of Sam Hou Fai, in terms of communication between public departments, but says that there are still situations that lack improvement. One of the examples pointed out to the newspaper is the assignment of licenses for the creation of business, especially in the restoration sector, where the bureaucracy still reigns, he said. It is something that the business sector pays close attention because it is a subject that requires the answer of various public services, and it is necessary, for it law, to review the entire structure of the departments involved in order to give more convenience to the population. The deputy asks for a better coordination mechanism to increase the effectiveness of license assignment work.

item.title: Game | Tax revenues until July increase 3.4% compared to 2024
item.description:
The government has collected more than 53.37 billion Patacas in taxes on game in the first seven months of the year, which represented a 3.4 percent rise in annual terms. Adding all tax revenues, the masheds amoealou until July almost 62.3 billion in taxes
Tax recipes on the game industry are rising. According to data from the Board of Finance Services (DSF), between January and July 53.37 billion of taxes on the game were collected, which means a 3.4 percent increase over the same period last year. Compared to 2024, in the early years of seven months of this year, another 1.77 billion was collected from the game dealers. In a monthly terms, in July the Government amazed 8.11 billion Patacas in taxes on the game, which represented an increase of 19 percent compared to tax revenues collected to casinos in July 2024. It is recalled that the concessions established for a decade, and that they began to be in force from 1 January 2023, set a 40 percent tax on the gross revenues of the territory casinos. After the budgetary review, the SAM Hou Fai Executive put 88.56 billion the estimates for tax revenues on the game by 2025. According to the latest DSF data, in late July more than 60 percent of taxes on government was eased for the entire year. In addition, throughout the year, taxes on the game represented 86.3 percent of all tax revenues calculated by the end of July. Good harvests In terms of gross revenue accumulated by casinos, the first seven months of this year registered a 6.5 percent increase over the previous year, with a total of 140.896 billion patacas against 132.348 billion patacas between January and July 2024. Extending the scope of taxes collected in 2025, DSF reveals total revenues this year until July of almost 62.3 billion patacas and total expenses to be around 50.65 billion patacas, resulting in a positive balance of 11.63 billion patacas. During the same period last year, total budget revenues were 61.5 billion patacas, which at the time represented an increase of more than 10 billion compared to 2023. Following the upward trajectory, the budget balance accumulated in the first seven months of 2025 is 2.33 billion higher than exceeding the same period as 2024.

item.title: Gastronomy | Government promotes zape zone with tourist attraction
item.description:
This week takes place the tourist and gastronomic initiative “Zape with Flavors”, between the pedestrian zones of Cantão Street and Xangai Street. From the 15th to the 24th of this month it will be possible to participate in a fair with the participation of local traders and that brings musical attractions and entertainment
The Zape area [landfill zone] has been on the agenda with requests for urban requalification and tourism, taking into account the closure of some satellite casinos at the site. In this context, the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD), in partnership with the General Association of the Overseas Chinese of Macau (Agcum), decided to gather efforts and make a fair with gastronomy mixed with entertainment. “Zape with flavors” is the name of the event that runs between the 15th and 24th of this month, taking place in the pedestrian zones of Cantão Street and Rua de Shanghai. According to a statement from STD, the fair "will feature the participation of traders and local shows, combining diverse gastronomy and cultural and creative elements." The idea is that, presenting such a project in Zape, it can be “showing the Macao Community Charm”. Thus, it is intended to foster tourism in this area, with the snacks to be served between 15:30 and 22h under the theme “Flavors of Street Food in Food Truck”. “Southeast Asian customs and macao gastronomic diversity” are combined with six food and theme rulots and more than 30 stalls. Music for all This Zape fair will serve, in addition to food, games and entertainment for all tastes, as “local artists and associations will present dances and songs on stage, providing visitors with diverse experiences”, within the tourist ideas associated with gastronomy and, in turn, consumption. There will be a hundred meals places and "an area with several facilities for the public to take photographs." There are also incentives for consumption, because "during the fair period, if the public wants to buy any product on site, for every 100 patacas in purchases will have an opportunity to enter a claw game to take toys", and the higher the consumer value, the greater the number of offers. " There are also online promotions integrated in the program of “Zape with Flavors”. The organizing entities of this event say they have consulted the associations of traders in the zone “to explain the content of this activity and collect opinions”, in order to ensure the event without startle or great impact on noise and urban management.

item.title: Pacific | Ramos-Horta asks for more financing to combat climate change
item.description: The Timorese President, José Ramos-Horta, defended yesterday further financing for Timor-Leste and Pacific countries due to climate change in a region that little contributes to emissions of gas. "Climate change is not a distant threat-they are a present crisis for Timor-Leste and our Pacific neighbors," the head of state said in a press release after traveling to Melbourne, Australia, to participate in a summit on reducing gas emissions in Australlasia. "In this summit, I will stress that global carbon-neutral ambitions should include justice, financing and tangible support for those who least contribute to emissions, but who suffer the most with their impacts. Australia's leadership is vital and together we must ensure that no community is behind the fight for a sustainable future," added Ramos-Horta. According to the Timorese Presidency statement, the participation of the Nobel Peace Prize in the Meeting demonstrates the “Commitment of Timor-Leste to Global Climate Action, Sustainable Development and Regional Cooperation”. During his stay in Melbourne, which ends on Wednesday, the Timorese President will grant the Order of Timor-Leste various personalities and organizations that contributed to the country's development. José Ramos-Horta will also visit the “Corner Store Café”, the largest Australian company specializing in toasting Café Timorese, to highlight the “importance of sustainable trade and economic initiatives led by the communities”, can read in the presidential statement.

item.title: Air Macau | Company alerts for fake promotions
item.description: Air Macau airline has published an alert on social networks in which it asks the population to be more vigilant in order to avoid mockery or schemes associated with false promotions on behalf of the company. “Recently our company has discovered false pages of travel agency, with local brands, on the social network Facebook. These pages disclose false ads on behalf of Air Macau where cheaper flights are available, appealing to users to fill personal data [online],” reads in the statement. Thus, Air Macau suggests that users always check the source of the information in these websites, confirming through the official Air Macau page or even by telephone call for the travel agencies themselves. Regarding false advertisements that appeal to preparation, Air Macao leaves the alert so that users do not transfer money through non-common payment platforms, or if access to the user's bank account is requested, as there is the risk of slopping.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Zhao Gou (1107-1187), Emperor Gaozong (R.1127-62), lived the difficult time of recreation of the Song dynasty, when in 1127 his members were forced by the Jurchen nomades to abandon the capital Bianjing (current Kaifeng) towards the southern. Of these unsettling times with which the South Song (1127-1279) was started the escape itinerary made them pass through Nanjing, where they went to the current Shangqiu, then Yangzhou until they set a new capital in Linan (current Hangzhou) in 1129. Xiansheng Cilie (1115-1197), the Emperor's wife, or simply Song's Empress Wu who was, like he lover of the brush arts, recalled with bitterness in a brief poem: “Here beautiful plums are early and peach-winged by the wind,/ In the light of dusk, the Jade album in the vicent Celeste./ In Yangzhou I met the soft face of the spring breeze,/ comparing all the flowers, in general, nothing resembles the others. Everything, by the way, would be a little different. In the influence of neo-confutic philosophy, the reform of the society from the bottom up was now sought. Seeing painters' works, there will be a tendency to reduce the size of the paintings, abandoning the great scenarios with the large mountain visually dominating other smaller ones suggesting a order from above, and a closer form of representation emerges from more intimate scenes linked to everyday life. An example of this change is seen in the works of Su Hanchen (1094-1172), a painter of the Imperial Academy, sponsored by Gaozong's father, the inspired Emperor Huizong (1082-1135). In a painting made in a round range (Tuanshan) is a lady sitting in front of a parker in a garden (paint, color and gold on silk, 25.2 x 26.7 cm, at the Museum of Fine Arts of Boston). Seen from her back, her face appears in the mirror she holds in her right hand, stressing the fact that we are admiring a private moment. Su Hanchen would, however, be more recognized by two themes that would become genres within figurative painting. The scenes of children playing, Yingxi Tu, shown in different environments and bucket salespeople, Huolang Tu, transporting a huge paraphernalia of objects, usually cheap articles accessible to all. Both figures capable of provoking an unconstant joy. In two paintings that are at the National Palace Museum in Taipei (one of them, a vertical roller, ink and silk color, 181.5 x 267.3 cm) joins both themes, showing the street vendor welcomed by children from rich families. In a foreboding of what would come next. After all, with a smaller territory, the dynasty resumed in the south by Gaozong would be even more prosperous than in the north.

item.title: Iam | Cats captured due to complaints from the University of Macau
item.description:
The collection of cats from the land of the University of Macao resulted from “university complaints about the large amount of cats in its campus,” the institute for municipal affairs told HM. The public body removes, for now, the scenario of slaughtering animals, feared by the students
The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) clarifies that the collection of 15 cats between July 22 and 25 of the University of Macao campus (one) emerged in response to complaints from the institution of higher education in relation to hygiene problems in the campus generated by the presence of animals. "AMI has constantly receiving complaints from one about the large amount of cats on its campus and food waste that is not removed in time and affecting environmental hygiene," was referred to in the response sent to HM. UM UM Campus Cats led to a wave of students' indignation, who say Temer the slaughter of animals after the period of complaint and adoption. AMI will move away, this scenario. "Regarding cats captured, if they are not claimed by the owner after the period of complaint, AMI will implement the policy of" open capture, sterilization and adoption "(TNA), prioritizing finding appropriate adopters for cats. It should be noted that AMI does not set a deadline for retention of the adopted animals." In the same answer it is said that during the waiting period for host families, AMI “will continue to provide clinical care and daily care to animals, never existing their slaughtering situation due to the term of retention period”. In this sense, it is explained that AMI veterinarians “are performing a series of medical care that include body examination, vaccine administration and microchips.” In addition, “cats can only be available for adoption after being sterilized,” Iam said. “Lack of sensitivity” The warnings for the adoption of these animals continue on social networks, and in a note sent to HM and signed by “a member of the UMERS - UMM groups”, is questioned the “worrying situation” that occurred during the summer vacation and therefore the absence of most students.
“These cats, considered an integral part of the university community, survived the sign of signal 10, but unfortunately they could not escape these AMI capture operations in recent days. For many students and teachers, these cats were like 'veterans' of campus, following them during significant moments of academic life and providing comfort and joy in the university environment.” The note explains that "UMERS" members cannot adopt cats "due to various circumstances," such as family allergies, possession of other animals, or "additional restrictions" for students in the interior of China. The alerts on social networks aim to “sensitize the public for this situation and encourage people with adequate conditions to adopt these cats in the municipal Kennel of Macau. On the Red Note platform there is even the group “A CatStories”, where the stories of cats captured by AMI are shared, and only one publication generated 460 tastes and 160 comments. A group was also created on Facebook, “Macao Cats II”, and there is also publications on Threads, with a total of 500 tastes and 500 shares, including the ten thousand views. One of the profiles of the "a catstories" concerns a "slight little cat," described as "a" unnamed "file, just created on the computer: still blank, slowly exploring the world and trying to type loose fragments to write" his own story. “Hurryned to a corner, I watch the people who pass, evaluating who can become an important character of my plot. So far, few people have been written in my story, and I have also left few brands in someone's life. Before leaving the campus maybe this" unnamed "file is only 5kb, registering some timid explorations and a soft desire for human warmth," reads the adoption. The HM questioned one on this subject, given that the animals were being cherished by the students, but until the closing of the edition did not receive an answer. "UMERS" members also question how one can one, "an institution that seeks academic excellence and better classifications in the world rankings, demonstrate such a lack of sensitivity, allowing the capture of these animals without any alternative solution." Aborted association In the same grade it is said that students considered creating an association to “organize the sterilization of campus cats, but the university did not approve the creation of such a student association”. UMERS members enhance “contrast with renowned universities in the interior of China, such as the University of Beijing, where there is a student association dedicated to the care of university campus cats, and at the University of Zhejiang, where UM UM Rector Song Yonghua has previously worked an association to protect university campus animals since 2005”. Regarding animal collection and treatment actions, AMI says that "TNA policies correspond to the guiding principles of the World Animal Health Organization (WOAH), which contribute to reducing the possibility of stray animals being exposed to disease and facing unfavorable environmental factors." Such policies also contribute to the reduction of the number of animals "and their excessive long -term reproduction." It is also noted that "TNA policies still take into account the state of survival and welfare of animals, in order to find adopting families for animals with conditions, dedicating themselves to helping them to obtain permanent and stable proper care." The AMI also says it has "constantly optimized the municipal kennels", and in recent years, "complementary facilities and equipment have been perfected." In addition, there is also cooperation “with animal protection associations”, and joint projects in schools and community neighborhoods for animal adoption and care. Official data available on the AMI website indicates that in the first quarter of this year 264 animals were captured without microchip, which increased to 280 in the second quarter. The numbers are similar to the first two quarters of 2024: the first were caught 266 animals without microchip, followed by 327 animals in the second quarter. In the third and fourth quarters of last year 258 and 203 animals were caught, respectively. Regarding sterilization actions, in the first quarter of this year 289 were made, followed by 211 actions of this kind in the second quarter. In the first quarter of this year were claimed, or adopted, 102 cats and 29 dogs, and in the following quarter, 93 cats and 49 dogs were adopted. As for the number of animals slaughtered, in the first quarter of this year alone 32 cats and 69 dogs were killed. If in cats this number reduced in the second quarter to 11, the same did not happen with the dogs: 101 were slaughtered.

item.title: CCCM | Fusion with Foundation for Science and Technology creates new agency
item.description:
Operating since 1999, the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology and the National Innovation Agency, creating a new institution. The practical consequences for the CCCM that aims to promote studies on Macao, China and Asia in Portugal are unknown. The president of the center says it is early to make comments
It is not known whether it will maintain its name, the number of scholarships for studies on China, Macao and Asia, or whether to change staff, but what is certain is that the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) and the National Innovation Agency. Of these three entities will be born the new agency for research and innovation. The process is linked to the desire to reform the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology by the Portuguese government led by Luís Montenegro, and the changes were announced on Thursday. However, there is still no great information about the consequences of this merger to the CCCM. At HM, Carmen Amado Mendes, its president, chose to refer to clarification for the future operation of the center, considering that it is "premature" to give answers about something "that is not yet defined." On Thursday, Minister Fernando Alexandre announced the reform of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation with the extinction of several entities, including FCT that has been the main financier of PhD and other research projects in Portugal. The reform of the ministry was approved by the Council of Ministers and, at a press conference at the end of the meeting, Fernando Alexandre justified the restructuring by describing his ministry as an “anacronic structure”, with fragmented organizations, disintegrated information systems and disarticulated governance. With 18 entities and 27 higher leaders between the services of the non -higher education system and higher education, science and innovation, the ministry will have only seven entities and 27 higher leaders, with the integration of extinguished entities into new entities. Regarding the extinction of the FCT, the minister assured that the financing of science will be preserved, with funding for four years that guarantees stability, predictability and “the protection of the financing of the most basic fundamental investigation”. “When we started thinking about this reform, we do it with a vision: to ensure equal opportunities to access quality education,” said Fernando Alexandre, also underlining the reinforcement of the education system. Marcelo can veto The extinction of FCT has generated some less good reactions in Portugal because it fears a reduction in investment in science and research. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, said he had “the sensation” that the foundation was replaced “with an agency in which he was integrated, and had other functions beyond those of FCT.” Marcelo acknowledged that the Foundation was a “very old structure” and that “it had many aspects that deserved to be rethought”, but said: “Just seeing what the new agency will do can I answer if this extinction is a good or bad idea.” As for the eventual 'green light' from Belém, Marcelo said that if he thinks this extinction is "good", promulgates the diploma "without anguish." "If you have doubts about a point that is this diploma that is very important I ask the government to rethink. It has happened. I may not veto soon. If the government insists, I can come to veto, if it is until the end of my mandate," he also admitted. A history of the transition The CCCM was born in 1995 during the administration of Vasco Rocha Vieira, the last Portuguese governor of Macao, intending to be “a place of excellence for the dissemination of Macau, its history, its culture and its economy”, reads in the memories of Rocha Vieira, “to all the ports I arrived”. This entity, operating in the Alcântara area, in Lisbon, was inaugurated in November 1999 by the then President of the Republic, Jorge Sampaio, and had as first president Alexandra Costa Gomes. On the CCCM website it is read that the institution is endowed with administrative autonomy and its own heritage, being a public institute integrated in the indirect administration of the state and under the tutelage of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation. In the objective booklet, it is read that the CCCM “has as its mission to produce, promote and disseminate knowledge about Macao as a platform between Portugal and the Popular Republic of China, as well as between Europe and Asia”, also presenting itself as “a space dedicated to the study and teaching of Chinese language, culture and history”. The center has also been established as "a center for scientific research and continuous and advanced training on the relations between Portugal and China, as well as between Europe and Asia." After the long presidency of Luís Filipe Barreto, academic at the University of Lisbon, the CCCM began to be chaired, from February 2020, by Carmen Amado Mendes. The leader recently saw her service committee renewed by 2030. A few months after taking office as president, Carmen Amado Mendes presented, on September 18, 2020, the new “Strategic Development Plan of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center 2020-2030”. Since then, the CCCM has awarded dozens of doctoral scholarships for the studies of Macao, China and Asia, and the “Spring Conferences”, which bring together academic performances around the same themes every year. Also noteworthy that the CCCM opened, in December last year, the “Gallery of Governors”, with 41 paintings of the former Portuguese governors of Macao. A new building that houses the file and library was also inaugurated. This plan sets objectives by 2030, "the reinforcement of scientific and cultural cooperation in the domain of past understanding, present and future trends of relations between Europe and Asia." With regard to archives, it is intended to “modernize and dynamization within a network of documentation centers and international reference file on euro-seatic themes, with emphasis on the various files in Lisbon, but also in Portugal and Europe”. Given that CCCM houses, in its facilities, the Macao Museum, the board points to the “insertion and appreciation in the museum network at the level of Lisbon and National”. The central idea of the plan was to develop, by 2030, “CCCM facilities as a pole of streamlining scientific, cultural and economic relations between Portugal and China, including the installation of entities such as the Luso-Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the Erasmus+Youth Entrepreneurs Association, as well as research nuclei in eurical studies”. It remains to be seen if, with the merger, all these initiatives will continue their initial course.

item.title: Tariffs: Seven agreements since Trump arrived at the White House
item.description:
The United States have reached seven bilateral trade agreements since Donald Trump returned to the White House in January and the latest, signed on Sunday with the European Union (EU), is the largest in terms of business volume. In addition to the EU agreement, the US government has agreed new commercial terms with the United Kingdom, China, Vietnam, Japan, Philippines and Indonesia, while negotiations continue with dozens from other countries, US authorities. Here is the data from the list of the seven bilateral trade agreements that Trump was able to obtain since January, when he returned to the White House for a second presidential term. +++ United Kingdom +++ Signed on May 8, it was the first bilateral agreement signed by Trump since the US government announced a new tariff plan. This agreement establishes the reduction of tariffs on British cars from 25% to 10% - up to 100,000 vehicles per year - and the elimination of steel and aluminum tariffs; Reciprocal permissions for export of beef and agricultural products, as well as reduction of non -tariff barriers and simplification of customs procedures. +++ China +++ On June 26, after reciprocal threats of tariffs up to 115%, the United States and China have reached an agreement of principle that is still being developed. Although it keeps high rates-55% for exporting certain Chinese products to the United States-facilitates the export of rare land in China, eliminates mutual retaliation measures and softens controls on Chinese products to the US market. +++ Vietnam +++ The US and Vietnam agreed on July 2 to increase the vietnamese exports to the US to 20% (with a 40% rate on the products suspected of being Chinese origin). Trump's previous threat was to establish tariffs in the 46%.
++ Japan ++ Japan agrees with a 15% rate on all its exports to the United States compared to the 25% rate with which Trump had threatened. The country was committed to investing $ 550 billion (about 470 billion euros) in the US and opening its markets to sectors such as car, rice and agricultural products. ++ Philippines ++ The US now imposing a 19% rate on Philippine products, less a percentage point than the 20% that had threatened, in exchange for the exemption of tariffs on US products that enter the Philippines. The announcement was made on July 22, after the visit of Filipino President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., to the White House. ++ Indonesia ++ On the same date, July 22, and with almost identical content, Trump's agreement with Indonesia establishes 19% rates on exports to the United States and, in parallel, includes aircraft purchase commitments, US agricultural and energy products. ++ European Union ++ On Sunday, July 27, the trade agreement between the United States and the EU was announced, which states that most European exports will be subject to 15% fees - Trump had threatened with 30% - but included tariff exemptions for certain products. In the agreement, the EU is committed to buying $ 750 billion (about 650 billion euros) in the United States, investing $ 600 billion (about 510 billion euros) in the country and increasing its US military equipment purchases.

item.title: Australia | Great Coral Barrier has been declining since there is a record
item.description: The Great Barrier of Choir, with 2,300 kilometers long, off the Australian East, has been suffering the largest coral decline since registrations began in 1986, a yesterday report published. The Australian Institute of Marine Sciences, of the government, documented the condition of 124 reefs between August 2024 and May 2025 to determine the widespread coral lanchament in the three sections of the Greater Barrier. The impact is higher in the northern areas (Cape York to Cooktown), with a 24.8 percent decline compared to the 2024, and southern levels (proserpine to gladstone), with 30.6 percent, representing these two values “the largest annual decline in coral cover” in 39 years. In the central region (cooktown to proserpine), the decline recorded is 13.9 percent compared to last year. The last episode of bleaching on site, declared UNESCO's World Heritage Site, has a "high to extreme" prevalence in all three areas, scientists find in the report. “Individual reefs registered a decline of corals of up to 70.8 percent” near Lizard Island in the North Zone, it refers to the study. The death of the corals, manifested by its bleaching, is caused by the impact of water heating - temperatures were recorded one to 2.5 degrees above average during the southern summer of 2025 - associated with the climate crisis. The large coral barrier “experienced unprecedented levels of thermal stress, resulting in the larger and more severe laundering that there is registration to date,” it reads in the document, in reference to the phenomenon that occurred in 2024 and continued during the first months of this year. The Australian agency warns that the habitat can reach “a point of non -return”, where the choir cannot quickly recover sufficiently between catastrophic events.

item.title: Hong Kong | Economic Report Highlights Startup “Historical Record”
item.description:
"Hong Kong's startups are on the rise." This is how the executive in the neighboring region describes the business environment in the region, where they were created in 2024 about 4,700 startups, plus 10 percent of 2023. In the "Report of Hong Kong's Business Environment 2025" it is read that the territory is far from losing economic competitiveness
The Hong Kong government released last July 30 the latest report on the neighboring region's economic scene. And one of the highlights is given to the scenario of growth of entrepreneurship. In the “Report of Hong Kong's Business Environment 2025” [Hong Kong 2025 Business Environment Report] it is noteworthy that “Startups in Hong Kong are on the rise”, given that last year there were “about 4,700 startups in the city, a historic record and an increase of 10 percent from the previous year”. The document explains that "more than a quarter of these startups has founders from outside Hong Kong," it is companies that operate in a "broad spectrum of sectors, including Fintech [High Technology], Electronic Trade and Information, Informatics and Technology", having hired more than 17,000 people. This number of human resources also represents an increase of seven percent compared to 2023. "All this is proof of Hong Kong's strong appeal for startup entrepreneurs," the authorities highlight. But it is not only startups that record growth, with the report to point out that the current government, led by executive head John Lee, "achieved remarkable results in attracting companies, investments and talents." "For example, in 2024, the number of companies in Hong Kong with headquarters outside the territory increased significantly by about 10 percent, reaching almost 10,000." The “Office for the attraction of strategic companies, created more than two years ago, attracted 84 strategic companies to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, including companies with market capitalization or valuation of over $ 10 billion, involving cutting -edge technology”, it is added. The report also points out that between January 2023 and the first half of this year, Invest Hong Kong, linked to the Raehk government's direct foreign investment department, "helped over 1300 foreign and continent companies establishing or expanding their business in Hong Kong, bringing investments of over $ 160 billion." Still with regard to Invest Hong Kong, the entity helped "539 companies from the continent or foreign to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, which represents an annual growth of over 40 percent." At the end of June this year, Hong Kong had 1.5 million local companies, while the total number of companies not registered in Hong Kong reached 15 509. "Both numbers represent historical records," it reads, and for the government of the neighboring territory the data "demonstrate the great confidence that continent and abroad companies have in the future of Hong Kong." Given that Hong Kong also has a talent capture program, the Hong Kong Talent Engage, reads in the report that by June this year "were received about 500,000 candidates in the shelter of various talent admission programs, of which about 330,000 were approved." Of these numbers, Hong Kong actually arrived to work 220,000 qualified frames. Good scholarship scenario Quoted on an official press release, a government spokesman stated that "in a complex and volatile external environment, Hong Kong is undergoing a phase of economic update and transformation, but there are more opportunities than challenges." Given that the territory has always positioned itself as a strong financial market worldwide, this scenario seems to have recorded a recovery in recent years. “This year Hong Kong's financial market performance has been constantly improving. The Hang SENG Index has a 18 percent increase last year and an increase of more than 25 percent this year so far. The average daily business volume in the first half of the year was about $ 240 billion, with an increase of about 120 percent.” Authorities highlight the maintenance of the economic competitiveness of the territory, pointing out that "over the years Hong Kong has been constantly classified as a global leader in economic freedom and competitiveness." Attention to the trade war In conclusion, Raehk's government clarifies that territory seems to maintain economic stability in times of constant commercial conflicts, with Donald Trump threatening and imposing tariffs on a number of countries. “As volatile and turbulent as the world may be, we remain firmly committed to the rules -based multilateral commercial system, with the WTO [World Trade Organization] as a nucleus, while actively participating and supporting regional economic cooperation.” The “numerous advantages of Hong Kong” are referred to, with its “highly internationalized business environment, a flexible and solid financial system, a simple and secure tax regime with low tax rates and a robust and independent legal system”. However, in the document it is also stressed that the “tariff war caused a global reallocation of capital”, and Hong Kong wants to bet on the attraction of “foreign companies and capital” to the region. The report also tells that "international organizations and foreign trade chambers in Hong Kong are confident in the future perspectives" of the territory, and that for the authorities "there is no reason to worry about some excessively pessimistic feelings." "In fact, the Raehk government is creating a new momentum and expanding the ability to support Hong Kong's economic growth, thus increasing its overall competitiveness and achieving high quality development," is still added. The executive spokesman also established a parallelism between good economic situation and political stability. "In recent years, the implementation of the National Security Law has restored a stable social environment in Hong Kong. This not only protected the rights and freedoms of the general public, but also made Hong Kong a safe haven to attract international capital and investment," he concluded. The report was presented by the secretary for Hong Kong finances, Paul Chan.

item.title: Rain | HK alerts and more than 80,000 residents of Beijing removed from home
item.description:
China and Hong Kong have faced periods of heavy rainfall in recent days that have forced extra care and residents' travel. In the Chinese capital 82,000 people had to leave their homes, while in Hong Kong streets and a hospital suffered floods and some subway stations were closed
Strong rains continue not to give respite, not only in Macau (see page 7), but in Hong Kong and in the interior of the country. In the case of China, Beijing authorities moved more than 82,000 people from home due to torrential rain, a week after deadly floods that led those responsible for recognizing failures in the response, the official news agency Xinhua said yesterday. Thus, tens of thousands of residents were removed from the most affected areas by rain until 9 pm on Monday, local time, according to the Municipal Flood Response Center. The center warned of the high risk of floods in the districts of Miyun (northwest), Fangshan (southwest), lied (west) and Huairou (north). The Chinese capital kept in force the red alert-the highest-until yesterday morning, before predictions of heavy rainfall between Monday to noon and the morning of Tuesday. Last week, these same rural districts north of Beijing were the most affected by the weather that caused 44 dead and nine missing, according to official data. Most of the deadly victims were registered in a home of elderly in Miyun. New measures in agriculture The severity of the catastrophe led municipal authorities to recognize “gaps” in the preparation of emergency services. Natural disasters are frequent in China during summer, with some regions subject to torrential rainfall and others to severe droughts. However, the Chinese authorities have reinforced the device to respond to the adverse effects of intense rainfall and heat waves on agricultural crops in various regions of the country, at a crucial time for autumn harvesting. Since the beginning of the rainy season, east and northern China zones have recorded episodes of extreme precipitation, while provinces such as Henan (center) and Anhui (East) face prolonged periods of drought and high temperatures. This combination of meteorological phenomena represents a challenge for farmers, especially when about two months left to harvest the main autumn cereals, the official news agency Xinhua yesterday pointed out. In the province of Shaanxi (Center), where precipitation recently exceeded 100 millimeters in less than 24 hours, local authorities adopted preventive measures such as channel cleaning and reinforcement of dikes, which allowed to protect most of the cultivated lands. However, Henan agricultural cooperatives affected by drought opted for gout watering systems and localized application of fertilizers to conserve moisture and minimize losses. Authorities have given priority to the rehabilitation of water infrastructure and the dissemination of efficient water management techniques in the absence of precipitation in some areas. The autumn campaign represents a fundamental component of China's annual cereal production. Num comunicado divulgado ontem, o Ministério da Agricultura e dos Assuntos Rurais alertou que as condições meteorológicas nas próximas semanas serão determinantes e apelou a “todos os esforços para proteger a colheita e dar um forte apoio à segurança alimentar do país”. O Presidente chinês, Xi Jinping, afirmou em 2023 que, apesar de “1.400 milhões de chineses comerem bem” actualmente, “a questão alimentar não deve ser descuidada”, sublinhando que o fornecimento de comida “não é um assunto insignificante”. China has less than nine percent of the planet's aurable land, although it represents about 18 percent of the world's population. In the last summers, weather disasters have caused significant damage in the country: the 2023 stituation months were marked by flooding in Beijing, which caused more than 30 dead, while by 2022 several extreme and dried heat waves hit the center and east of China. Hong Kong on Alert With regard to the panorama of heavy rains in neighboring territory, they have not given respite either. According to public broadcaster RTHK, some hong Kong stations were closed yesterday due to the risk of flooding, given that the Hong Kong Observatory kept the black signal of storm [Black Rainestorm Warning Signal] until around 17 hours. Winds of about 110 kilometers per hour were recorded in some areas of the territory, and thunderstorms were also registered. The rthk channel also reveals that more than 10,800 lightnings were counted in the territory between midnight and 10 am yesterday, half of them occurred on Lantau Island. Until 11 am yesterday, the authorities responsible for the drainage systems recorded 21 episodes of flooding, and 180 emergency responses were made in 240 different locations. Highlight for the occurrence of an episode at Queen Mary Hospital this Tuesday, namely “on some roads” hospital access in Pok Fu Lam, and patients were displaced by firefighters to Ruttonjee Hospital in the Wanchai area. In some zones of the hospital the water reached the knees, and sand bags were placed to stop the flow of the rains. At about 11 am yesterday this scenario was resolved, with the normal one returning to the Queen Mary Hospital near noon. The rains also led to the large increase in water level in the Lower Shing Mun reservoir in the Sha Tin area, which led to the notification of nearby housing complexes, such as Mei Lam Estate, May Shing Court, Mei Chung Court and Granville Garden. Despite the heavy rains, some people went to work normally doing alternative routes. This was the case of Mak, a woman who, to the RTHK channel, said she had to make a deviation to get to the office. “I couldn't go straight to there and had to make a longer route. The metro [mtr] made some warnings [about the storm and closures], but I would like them to do them in the carriages as well, because I only realized that access was closed when I got to the exit,” he described. The sun Information provided by the Hong Kong Observatory speaks of the passage of an active "southwest monsoon and high altitude disturbances that are bringing heavy rainfall and violent thunderstorms to the southern coast of China and the northern part of the southern China Sea." Yesterday the highest daily precipitation record was broken to August since 1884, upon registered, until 14h, 355.7 millimeters of precipitation at the Observatory's headquarters. For today time should stay unstable in Hong Kong, with “heavy rains at the beginning” of the day. However, these "should gradually decrease" tomorrow, expected "a lot of heat with sunny periods in the next two days." Also the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) leave a heavy rain alert to this day with “frequent, sometimes intense, thunderstorm”. The sun is expected to start appearing at the MSAR from tomorrow, still with some clouds, extending this weather scenario until next Monday. Temperatures should reach 33 degrees.

item.title: USJ | Researchers discover a new species of bacteria in Portugal
item.description:
A team of local university researchers identified a new species of bacteria in the Salinas of Rio Maior, Portugal. The type of discovered organism, which lives in extreme environments, widens the limits of biological knowledge and may have implications in areas such as biomedicine, pharmacy or even spatial exploration
There is news in the field of microbiology thanks to the latest discovery of a team of researchers linked to the University of São José (USJ), led by André Antunes, interim director of the Institute of Sciences and Environment of the same educational institution. It is the discovery of a new species of bacteria from 12 samples collected in the Salinas of Rio Maior, in Portugal, which led to the establishment of the new species “Fodinibius alkaliphilus”. The species of bacteria previously known as “Alifodinibius salipaludis” for “Fodinibius salipaludis” was also reclassified. The conclusions appear in the article “Fodinibius alkaliphilus sp. Nov., Moderately halophilic and alkaliphilic bacterium isolated from an Inland Saltern in central and reclassification of aliifodinibius salipaludi as fodinibius salipalis sp. SYSTEMATIC AND EVOLUTIONARY MICROBIOLOGY. The scientific journal is a publication “reference for new macrobial data”, being the official publication of the International Procaryotes Systematic Committee and the Applied Bacteriology and Microbiology Division of the International Union of Microbiological Societies, describes a USJ note. In addition to André Antunes, the authors team includes researchers from the University of Science and Technology of Macau, coordinated by Marta Filipa Simões; Researchers at the University of Minho and Seville University. According to the same USJ note, "the new [bacteria] species grows better in salinities about four times higher than those of seawater and also prefers alkaline conditions, combining the ability to grow in different extreme environmental conditions." The importance of this type of studies, including analyzes to “such extreme environments”, is “future applications in a wide range of fields, including biomedical and pharmaceutical, but also extends to the discovery of new useful materials and the provision of useful information for future space exploration”. The same team of investigators is not stopped, as "other samples of these places are currently being investigated and new publications describing other new species are expected in the coming months." “This publication highlights the strengths of Macao in articulation with partners from Portuguese and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as its growing importance in the fields of biodiversity and biotechnology,” is still described. The Power of Salinas The researchers explain that "the species Aliifodinibius Salipaludis has been described, but their name has not yet been validly published." In field work the team isolated these species from “hypersaline environments, including saline, salt mines and saline soils”. Prior to the field work itself, the team conducted “an investigation to the microbial diversity of hypersaline environments in downtown Portugal”, with samples in the Rio Maior zone in July 2019, 12 genera bacteria were isolated from the Rio Maior salines. Located in the central area of Portugal, in these Salinas there is the “brine, which is about seven times more salty than seawater”, being “pumping from a well and generated by the crossing of a local underground course with an extensive salt deposit”. item.title: Food Waste | Pereira Coutinho suggests combat plan
item.description:
José Pereira Coutinho wants the government to combat food waste and the abundance culture of banquets and buffets to be coordinated with food banks and charities. The deputy asked if legislation is expected to encourage or oblige the separation of organic waste
Food waste in Macau is a problem for which Pereira Coutinho would like to see an integrated combat strategy. In a written interplies released yesterday, the deputy highlights the gap between the culture of abundance of social events and the operational difficulties in the collection of food surpluses for distribution to needy families and solidarity institutions. This culture, banquets, buffets and celebrations, “associated with commercial practices that oversee productions, generates critical volumes of surpluses, especially prepared breads, cakes and meals, aggravating the inefficiency of the food chain”, denounces the deputy. To solve food waste in the commercial sector, Pereira Coutinho asks the government if he intends to introduce “standards that encourage or oblige supermarkets, restaurants and other food companies to donate food surpluses still suitable for consumption to social solidarity institutions”. The deputy cites examples of laws in force in Portugal and France, which could be followed by the executive. In addition, it asks if it is possible to implement measures, such as tax incentives, logistical support, simplification of procedures or certification programs, to “facilitate the creation of systematic partnerships between commercial food establishments (supermarkets, restaurants, bakeries, hotels and others) and private entities such as food banks or charities”. So what about the environment? Putting the issue of food waste from the perspective of the popular concept of sustainability, Pereira Coutinho points out not only ethical challenges and their social and economic implications, but also environmental. Firstly, it is urgent to sensitize the population to the need to reduce food waste. The deputy then emphasizes the need to correct the “critical infrastructural disabilities in the management of organic waste, manifested in the absence of industrial composting centers and intelligent logistics networks to donate surpluses in time”. Also the ecological consequences, with greenhouse gas emissions, decomposition in landfills and incinerators, should be addressed. As such, Coutinho asks if the government considers it to create a legal framework that “encourages or obliges the separation of organic waste, namely eating waste, origin (domestic, commercial and institutional)”. The objective is to give proper treatment to waste, such as composting or anaerobic digestion, rather than the use of the landfill.

item.title: Silent angels
item.description: Last July 10, the Hong Kong TVB news reported that in Australia, Melbourne and Sydney, the courts started to have dogs to support the victims while witnessing in court. Labradors and Golden Retriever are preferred dogs for this function. They are sweet and can support the victims. It takes two years to train a “court dog” and costs approximately 150,000 hkd, a value similar to the training of a guide dog. Victims are usually women and children. They are mostly witness to the Family Court in domestic violence processes and are subject to great emotional tension. The monitoring of court dogs allows victims to relax, that interrogation time is reduced and the process to be facilitated. Tribunal dogs are trained by Guide Association, the training is paid by the Law Society, Australia, and are accommodated on the court's premises. Scientific research shows that dog monitoring can reduce the secretion of tension hormones, make thinking clearer and reduce stress more effectively. From a legal point of view, they have the advantage of not talking and cannot affect the witness of the victims. This measure is easily accepted by the accusation and defense. Australia is not the first country to appeal to court dogs. Already in 2021, Japan used them. There are currently four court dogs in Japan and are mainly used to accompany children while their testimonies are recorded. In an old case of children's abuse, a girl refused to go to court. Later, he bravely confronted the aggressor in public, accompanied by one of these "silent angels." This was the first time in Japan where a dog attended a trial. This is why these dogs are called “silent angels.” According to Japanese official data, 160,000 cases of child abuse were reported in 2019. If the number of court dogs will be increased to deal more effectively with these cases. In addition to Australia and Japan, court dogs are also used in the United Kingdom, the United States, France, Canada and Chile. There are currently 240 tax dogs in the United States, divided by 35 states. The law gives all equal rights. The Court uses standard procedures to hear the testimonies of the victims, the defendants and the witnesses of each case. Regardless of the equal rights of the complaint and the defendant, and the standardization of the court's procedures, each case presents its own difficulties. When the victim witness is emotionally disturbed and the details and the accuracy of the testimony are questionable. So, how can the court accept the testimony? How can vague testimony help but in the defendant's acquittal? The presence of court dogs to stabilize the emotions of the victims is important so that they can boldly report the facts and allow a fair judgment to be allowed. This measure reduces the suffering of those who revive a painful experience and manifest empathy with the victims. No wonder it is called the “silent angels” tax dogs. It is certainly appropriate to give good use to the special qualities of dogs for the benefit of humans. From these successful experiences, Hong Kong and Macao courts may consider implementing measures to improve the effectiveness of their procedures. In addition, there may be the need to adapt the court's premises to put, for example, dog bathrooms. Questions such as this should be considered before the use of court dogs is used. The measures needed to introduce tax dogs remind us many others that were previously implemented in the Hong Kong courts to help with the trials. For example, in the case of Donald Tsang, the former head of the Raehk executive, the case was broadcast live on television to allow it to be seen by all. Another example is the testimony of the victims of sexual abuse hidden by a screen; or of witnesses that are questioned by video called. None of these measures have to do with the law of the law, but have improved the effectiveness of judgment and are the demonstration that the feeling of the victims is taken into consideration. The implementation of measures aimed at the protection of the victims must be considered, either in the system of consummented law or in the civil law system. Finally, in addition to the use of court dogs, society should take steps to reduce cases of abuse, violation and violence against women and children. This is the correct approach to attacking the root of the problem and building a peaceful and friendly society. item.title: COP30 - A challenge for Brazil
item.description: The last two conferences of the United Nations Convention in the United Nations Convention on Climate Change took place in 2023 and 2024, respectively in the United Arab Emirates (COP28) and Azerbaijan (COP29), which, as oil producing countries, should not be very interested in energy transition. Now it is up to Brazil to organize CPO30, from November 10 to 25, 2025, in Belém, Pará. This is not the first time this country has been predisposed to organize such a conference. He had already been invited, and accepted the invitation to organize COP25. However, the government headed by Bolsonaro, a convinced negotiation such as his American mentor Donald Trump, "Roi the rope," said it as a said, claiming that the problem of climate change would be just a commercial game. Chile was then tasked with being the new host, but the great disorders that occurred in this country before the scheduled dates, made the conference to Madrid, between December 2 and 13, 2019. It was an opportunity that was lost to project Brazil as one of the leading countries of the fight against climate change. It turns out that Brazil is among the ten largest producers of gross oil and there are those who doubt that the Brazilian government is greatly interested in the energy transition. Undoubtedly, Lula da Silva's governments have taken into consideration, to some extent, the preservation of the Amazon and the well-being of indigenous populations, and have been committed in oil exploration in areas that may affect them. However, the great commercial value of oil makes it often subaltern the fact that fossil fuels are proven to be the main factor in increasing greenhouse gas concentration in the atmosphere and, consequently, global warming. There was even someone1 in Brazil who even said that oil exploration would contribute to funding the energy transition. There is no doubt that COP30 in Belém will contribute to Brazil has an increasingly important role in the context of the problem inherent in climate change. It will be necessary, however, much skill on the part of the Brazilian government to convince the international community about its intentions to the commitment made when the Paris Agreement signed, in which the need to limit global warming up, until the end of the 21st century, to a maximum of 2 ° C, preferably to values less than 1.5 ° C. In this context, the Brazilian official policy seems not to be very coherent, especially since it has already been approved by the House of Representatives and the Senate, the infamous project-Law No. 2159 of 2021, nicknamed “PL of devastation”, because it opens the way to potentially serious ventures to the environment, such as the much discussed “offshore” oil exploration near the Amazon River mouth. This project, also called “equatorial margin”, may, in the face of the risk of oil spill, affect indigenous communities and biodiversity in the vicinity of the exploration zone. In case of such happening, it would not be the first time in Brazil, meeting that, in 2001, a platform operated by Petrobras suffered several explosions, which caused its sinking with about 1,500 tons of gross oil and the death of 11 people. Incidents of this type in ocean facilities where perforation is not rare. Examples can be mentioned recurring strokes in the nineties of the last century in the North Sea on Shell-operated platforms, with serious consequences for the maritime environment. More recently there was a stroke in the Gulf of Mexico in 2010, where the damage of a security valve on a BP platform caused an explosion that caused the death of 8 workers and a stroke of about 780 million liters of oil, causing irreparable damage to maritime fauna. Incidents of this type may also affect ecosystems that mangais are part, causing damage to the transition zones between the coast and the sea, resulting in the destruction of ecosystems and the increase of erosion caused by the associated waves, or not, to storm tides. Aware of these inconvenient potentials, the Brazilian Institute of Environment and Renewable Natural Resources (Ibama), has been denied licenses for oil exploration several times in the vicinity of the mouth of the Amazon River. According to the “PL of devastation”, “special environmental licenses” may occur for projects considered strategic, which, after submission to the entity responsible for licensing and in the absence of response within one year, would automatically be licensed. Considering that Ibama is characterized by staff scarcity, there will be the risk of projects submitted to be approved, after this period. Given that the president can completely or partially veto the project-law, within 15 days after his submission by Congress2, it is now liable for Lula da Silva to take this attitude. There are only a few days to do so, because the deadline will in principle end on August 8. Throughout this process, President Lula da Silva, unlike the minister of the “Environment and Climate Change”, Marina Silva, has shown a certain passivity, which causes some fear about her attitude regarding the promulgation of the decree. According to the most progressive means in Brazil, Lula da Silva should not have been silent after the approval by Congress, but staying firm vetoing the project “PL of devastation” and other potentially disastrous and attentive projects of forests and populations. In case of veto, it needs to be explained by invoking legal or political reasons, such as unconstitutionality or not convenience or opportunity. In the meantime, an international campaign of Avaaz “Brazil: Stop the Devastation Bill” is underway, with about one million supporters. But not everything is in the hands of Lula, as, in case of veto, the project-Law returns to Congress, which may impose the promulgation of the respective law, if the veto is overthrown by the absolute majority of the votes of the deputies and senators. The last word is, therefore, from Congress. However, there is a great expectation of what will be the attitude of Lula da Silva. It is a tremendous challenge about the balance between environmental protection and economic development. item.title: Gastronomy | Government promotes zape zone with tourist attraction
item.description:

item.title: SMG | Tropical Cyclone may be tomorrow 800km from Macau
item.description:
The Tropical Cyclone Podul is intensifying east of Taiwan and will approach the southeast coast of China throughout the week. Meteorological and geophysical services estimate that they reach the degree of typhoon and is 800 kilometers from Macau on tomorrow afternoon and 400 kilometers on Thursday, when it will be tropical depression
After a few days of truce, the intense and thunderstorm rains will be able to hide Macao from mid -week as the impact of the Severo “Podul” tropical cyclone will intensify, which was yesterday located in the Northwest Pacific, east of Taiwan. Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) yesterday indicated that the storm is intensifying gradually and moving west at a speed of about 25 kilometers per hour. The latest forecast points to “Podul” intensify to the typhoon category when it is about 800 kilometers from Macau, tomorrow around 14h, when Taiwan will arrive. About 24 hours later, already on Thursday afternoon, predictions point to the reduction of the intensity of “Podul”, which will become a tropical depression, entering continental territory, about 400 kilometers northwest of Macao. Intensity questions Yesterday morning, the SMG still did not risk predicting a trajectory for the storm, pointing to two distinct predictions, before revealing the above estimate. "Different forecast models still have significant differences in their trajectories and subsequent development. Numerical models predict that the‘ Podul ’follow a more north trajectory towards the areas between Fujian and Zhejiang, but some numerical and artificial intelligence models predict a south more trajectory, approaching the east coast of Guangdong," said SMG. For now, the authorities report that the circulation of ‘podul’ is relatively small due to unfavorable development conditions, and it is expected to weaken after reaching Earth in Taiwan. The SMG warned yesterday to the continuation of “extremely hot in the coming days” due to the influence of “an anticyclone at high altitude”. However, with the approach of “Podul”, the weather on the coast of Guangdong will become unstable, with the likelihood of intense rain in the end of this week. If “Podul” follows a closer trajectory to the eastern coast of Guangdong, the wind and the rain in Macau will be more intense. The SMG appealed to the population to pay attention to the latest weather information, so that they can take contingency measures as soon as possible.

item.title: Air Macau | Company alerts for fake promotions

item.title: WYNN MACAU | Profits fell more than 20% in the second quarter
item.description:
Wynn Macau registered operational profits of $ 128.3 million in the second quarter of 2025, 20.78 percent than in the same period in 2024. The game operator will invest this year $ 250 million in the two properties in Macau
Wynn Macau's operational profits went down 20.78 percent in the second quarter of this year, compared to the same period, still reaching $ 128.3 million, according to results presented by the operator on Friday. The company indicated that the profits adjusted before interest, taxes, depreciation, amortization and income (EBITDAR) of the second quarter game concessionaire in Macao reached $ 253.7 million, a 9.5 percent drop over the previous year. The properties operated by Wynn Macau registered revenues of 883.5 million dollars between April and June, which remained virtually unchanged (-0.2 percent) compared to the same period of 2024, announced Wynn Resorts Ltd, which operates two resorts with casino in the special administrative region of Macao (Maca): Wynn Macau, and the peninsula, and the Wynn Palace in Cotai. By property, Wynn Palace operating revenues decreased by 1.5 percent from the previous year to $ 539.6 million, while the property's adjusted ebitdar dropped 14.8 percent to $ 157.2 million. Wynn Macau, on the other hand, registered operating revenues of $ 343.8 million, an increase of 1.9 percent over the previous year, with Ebitdar adjusted to advance slightly to $ 96.5 million. Wynn Macau and Wynn Palace casinos were responsible for most of the company's turnover, raising $ 741.7 million in revenues, more 2.2 percent than in the second quarter of last year. This year's investments "In Macao, although VIP retention has negatively affected the results, we have generated a healthy market share and a significant free cash flow, supporting our continuous investment in the properties of Macao," said Craig Billings, CEO of Wynn Resorts Ltd., quoted in the communication of the parent company. In semiannual terms, Wynn Macau registered operational profits of $ 255.4 million between January and June 2025, less 30.5 percent than in the first six months of the previous year. The dealership has also revealed that it will spend up to $ 250 million this year, including improvements in the hotel tower on its Wynn Macau property in the city center and at its Wynn Palace resort in Cotai. The information was revealed by Julie Cameron-Doe, the financial director of the mother company, Wynn Resorts Ltd, during the teleconference about the results of the group's second quarter. “We started two projects - an expansion of the Chairman’s Club game area at Wynn Palace and a Wynn Tower room renewal at Wynn Macau and, along with our other ongoing investment projects, we hope to spend a total of $ 200 and $ 250 million in 2025.” Recent government data indicate that casinos in the region registered, in the first seven months of the year, an increase of 6.5 percent of gross revenue accumulated in annual terms, with a total of 140.896 billion patacas against 132.348 billion between January and July 2024.

item.title: Tourists | Per capita expenses fall almost 13 percent
item.description:
Despite the annual climb of almost 15 percent of the number of tourists who visited Macau in the first six months of the year, total spending on the territory, not related to game, grew only 0.2 percent. Per capita expense fell 12.8 percent in the same period, for an average of 1,970 patacas
The increase in the number of tourists who visited Macau in the first half of this year was not reflected in the economy outside the casinos. According to data released on Friday by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC), the per capita expense of visitors not related to the game (1,970 patacas) recorded a 12.8 percent homologous decrease. In terms of origin, DSEC data show that tourists from the interior of China registered per capita expenses of 2,253 patacas in the first six months of the year, which represents a break of 14.4 percent. However, the sharper decrease found in international tourists, with a break of 16.9 percent (to 1,885 per capita patacas), a negative variation with little impact on the final accounts taking into account the small proportion of this segment in the total volume of tourists. Hong Kong visitors recorded the lowest per capita expense (940 patacas), a break of 13.4 percent in annual terms. When analyzed the reason for visiting Macao, tourists who came in the first six months of the year to the territory to participate in conventions/exhibitions and to attend shows/competitions continued to record higher per capita expenses, with 4,232 patacas and 4,161 patacas, respectively. Sea of people The number of tourists who passed by Macau in the first half of 2025 was only exceeded between January and June 2019, before the covid-19 pandemic, during which time almost 20.3 million visitors recorded. Despite the entry of 19.2 million visitors in the first half of this year, (an annual rise of 14.9 percent), total expenses made in the territory only increased 0.2 percent to about 37.86 billion patacas. In this chapter, the DSEC points out that the total expense of the excursionists (7.85 billion) increased by 7 percent, but that of tourists (30.01 billion patacas) descended 1.4 percent. However, the evolution of total expense improved between the first and second quarter, given that in the last period DSEC registered a 4.6 percent rise to a total of 18.25 billion patacas between April and June. During this time period, both non-game expenditure on tours (3.61 billion) increased 5.5 percent, such as tourists (14.64 billion patacas) rose 4.4 percent in annual terms, thanks to the significant increase in tourists who visited Macau. Still, in the second quarter of 2025, the per capita expense of visitors followed the negative trend with an annual break of 12.3 percent. The DSEC points out that “the per capita expense of tourists (3,663 patacas) and that of the excursionists (673 patacas) dropped 2.1 and 19.3 percent, respectively”.

item.title: Commerce | Volume of electronic payments fell more than 10%
item.description: In the first six months of this year, the volume of transactions made through electronic payments fell 10.2 percent, compared to the first half of last year, to a total of 25.05 billion patacas, according to data revealed on Friday by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). The largest descent was found in the field of trinkets and warehouse goods, with the descent of purchases using mobile applications to be almost 18 percent. Leather and jewelery and jewelery shops occupied the remaining places on the negative podium, with breaks of 11.9 and 10.3 percent, respectively. The only two branches analyzed by the DSEC that registered annual climbs in the first semester in electronic payments were supermarkets (1.5 percent) and pharmacies (7.7 percent). In the same period, the restoration sector followed the reverse route, with the rising of 3.1 percent electronic payments, to a total of 6.75 billion patacas. It should be noted that the retail trade sector has a turnover almost four time higher than restoration. The restaurants that registered the highest rise of transactions through electronic means were those of fast food.

item.title: Pacific | Ramos-Horta asks for more financing to combat climate change
